page.title: 01General Description
page.content: The area surveyed includes the north western section of Laindon, Dunton Wayletts and the edge of Little Burstead. The A127(T) divides the block into two distinct sections. To the south of the road the area is mainly residential and industrial, whereas to the north, land is mainly agriculture. The most important industrial site is the Ford Research and Engineering Centre at Dunton, where new cars and technical improvements are developed and tested. There are many small firms located on the rest of the industrial estate. New roads, such as West Mayne, are being built to improve communications and to attract new firms to the area as unemployment is a serious problem in the Laindon district Cereal growing is the main agricultural activity.
